title: A Famous Jazz Musician Says Goodbye to Live Music
summary: Mulatu Astatke, an 82-year-old musician from Ethiopia, played his last live concert in London. He is known as the 'Godfather of Ethiopian jazz' because he mixed Ethiopian music with jazz from around the world to create a special style called Ethio-jazz. He has been performing for 60 years and became more famous after his music was used in movies like Broken Flowers. At the concert, he played the vibraphone, an instrument with metal bars, and started with a song from the Ethiopian Orthodox church. The audience was very happy to see him, and people felt sad that he won't tour anymore. Mulatu smiled and thanked his fans but didn't say much about how he felt.

background_read: Mulatu Astatke is a musician from Ethiopia who is famous for creating Ethio-jazz, which blends Ethiopian traditional music with jazz. He has been playing music for over 60 years and is called the 'Godfather of Ethiopian jazz.' His music has been used in movies, helping more people around the world hear it. In this article, we learn about his last live concert, where he played the vibraphone and shared his unique sounds with fans one final time.
